name: McFearless
wikiSummary: "McFearless" is a song by American rock band Kings of Leon. It is the fourth track on their 2007 album Because Of The Times. It is one of the few tracks on the album where Jared Followill uses distortion effects on his bass, this track being the only one where he uses distortion throughout the whole song. The song, with its powerful, larger-than-life sound and distorted bass has drawn comparisons to U2.
wikiText:
"McFearless" is a song by American rock band Kings of Leon. It is the fourth track on their 2007 album Because Of The Times. It is one of the few tracks on the album where Jared Followill uses distortion effects on his bass, this track being the only one where he uses distortion throughout the whole song. The song, with its powerful, larger-than-life sound and distorted bass has drawn comparisons to U2.
 
 In an interview with XFM, Caleb stated he had difficulty writing lyrics but after recording the song, it became one of band's favorite songs off the album. The song was also named by Jared as it was based around his bassline.
